extendedIngredients.name: broccoli florets
extendedIngredients.original: 4 cups frozen broccoli florets, thawed and finely chopped

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 carton (8 ounces) spreadable chive and onion cream cheese

extendedIngredients.name: puff pastry
extendedIngredients.original: 1 package (17.3 ounces) frozen puff pastry, thawed
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 package (17.3 ounces) frozen puff pastry, thawed

title: Ham and Broccoli Puffs
instructions: Directions                                                                                In a large bowl, combine the first six ingredients. On a lightly floured surface, unfold puff pastry. Roll each sheet into a 12-in. square. Cut each into 16 squares.                                                                                            Place a heaping tablespoonful of broccoli mixture in the center of each square. Brush edges of pastry with eggs. Bring opposite corners over filling; pinch seams to seal.                                                                                           Place on ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 425° for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.                                        Yield: 32 appetizers.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Ham and Broccoli Puffs  in  Simple & DeliciousDecember/January 2011, p74                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             1 appetizer equals 122 calories, 8 g fat (3 g saturated fat), 20 mg cholesterol, 146 mg sodium, 10 g carbohydrate, 1 g fiber, 3 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                    Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: In a large bowl, combine the first six ingredients. On a lightly floured surface, unfold puff pastry.
Roll each sheet into a 12-in. square.
Place a heaping tablespoonful of broccoli mixture in the center of each square.
Brush edges of pastry with eggs. Bring opposite corners over filling; pinch seams to seal.
Bake at 425° for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown.
